When Crowley walks out of the burning bookstore with Somebody to Love playing in the background? Yeah I felt that. 

Just look...

When Crowley walks out of the burning bookstore with Somebody to Love playing in the background? Yeah I felt that.


Just look at his face. This show just keeps on breaking my heart.

summary: When I Watch the World Burn, All I Think About is You - Chapter 1 - greywolfheir
title: When I Watch the World Burn, All I Think About is You - Chapter 1 - greywolfheir
excerpt: Long ago, a war between humans and fairies led the to the banishment of fairies from the world of men. Now, one of those fairies--a dragon--has been terrorizing the Engelite kingdom, and Aziraphale must go on a quest to defeat the dragon in order to claim his right to the throne, joined by his personal knight and best friend, Sir Crowley.
description:
Hey guys, I wrote a multi-chapter AU fic! I began this long before the show was announced but it did inspire me to finish. Still, this is definitely book-based, so keep that in mind.

I’ll be posting each chapter one at a time every Wednesday, with a total of 7 chapters so if you want to wait for the full fic, that will be on August 7th.

blog.name: salamanderinspace
blog.title: Does Some Part of You Remember This Like I Do

tags: high femme pansexual power top crowley
summary: "I don't understand it," Aziraphale was saying.  "Why would you bother about THAT when you could sit down at a nice linen...
body:
“I don’t understand it,” Aziraphale was saying.  "Why would you bother about THAT when you could sit down at a nice linen tablecloth with… with a chicken cordon bleu.“  He leaned back in his antique chair so as to keep his breath off the candles, which were currently illuminating the bookshop.  It was a danger having candles, of course, after the fire, but he was proud of the decor and felt, rightly so, that Crowley would be more comfortable in the firelight.

"Because it’s fun!”  Crowley argued.  He took a sip of wine.  "I thought your lot was in favor of fun.  Good times.  Happy memories.  All that.“

"It doesn’t sound fun.  It sounds sweaty.”

“That’s part of the fun,” Crwoley cooed.  Setting aside his wine glass, he inched his chair closer to Aziraphale’s and leaned provocatively in that direction.  As gestures went, it was not subtle, but it did maintain the vaguest pretense of interest in the conversation.

“I’m very particular about touching.”  Aziraphale made a face.  He wasn’t feeling as tense as he looked, however, and Crowley sensed this.  They were both enjoying the topic for it’s tenth or eleventh emergence in their discussions.  It usually took around ten or eleven mentions for them to make real progress in an argument.

“Just think of it like dancing.”  In a moment of intense daring, and while moving his body as little as possible, Crowley snaked his arm around his friend’s shoulders and gave him a squeeze.  Aziraphale went rigid, then surrendered with a look so pleased he practically glowed.  

“Well, I do fancy a dance or two.”

blog.title: Obviously The Answer Is Obi-Wan’s A Ho

summary: 1. Get Well II - Icon for Hire - ‘Can't forget how it felt when it all fell apart / And we talk a big game like we wanna get...
body:
physician heal thyself, a playlist by rachaelizame on Spotify

1. Get Well II - Icon for Hire - ‘Can’t forget how it felt when it all fell apart / And we talk a big game like we wanna get well / In our prison made of pain / Only fooling ourselves’

2. Broken Crown - Mumford and Sons - ‘But oh, my heart was flawed / I knew my weakness / So hold my hand / Consign me not to darkness’

3. In The Shadows - The Rasmus - ‘Lately, I’ve been walking, walking in circles / Watching, waiting for something / Feel me, touch me, heal me / Come take me higher’

4. Man or a Monster - Sam Tinnesz - ‘In your hands, there’s a touch that can heal / But in those same hands, is the power to kill / Are you a man or a monster?’

5. Still Here - Superchick - ‘Cross through the night / I looked down and lost my way, my light / Brought to my knees / Though the dark surrounds, it pulls me down, I do not sink beneath’

6. Hurts Like Hell - Fleurie - ‘How can I put it down into words / When it’s almost too much for my soul alone / I loved and I loved and I lost you / And it hurts like hell’

7. I Found - Amber Run - ‘Oh, and I found love where it wasn’t supposed to be / Right in front of me / Talk some sense to me’

8. From Eden - Hozier - ‘Honey you’re familiar like my mirror years ago / Idealism sits in prison, chivalry fell on it’s sword / Innocence died screaming, honey ask me I should know / I slithered here from Eden just to sit outside your door’

blog.name: palpalbuddypal
blog.title: Howdy!
blog.description: Drop a request or a headcanon in the ask box! I will write for Good Omens, Critical Role, FFXV, and a few other fandoms.

summary: Red with Aziraphale ;)
question: Red with Aziraphale ;)
answer:
Red: Power, energy, passion, desire, speed, strength, power, heat, love, aggression, danger, fire, blood, war, violence, intensity, celebration, luck, stop, and danger.

There was a way to tell which snakes were poisonous, and which ones weren’t. Something to do with their colors, which ones touched red and which ones weren’t. Black and red? Yellow and red? Red and yellow, you’re an unlucky fellow. That made sense.

Especially when he looked at Crowley. Those big yellow eyes stared through him, even when shielded by his sunglasses. They were lantern bright, they were laser beams. Beacons. The worst part was how beautiful they were.

And the red, oh, the red was his hair. No matter how he styled it, it stayed the same vibrant hell-fire red. Aziraphle would’ve been lying if he said that he didn’t prefer it one way or another, he liked when it was long, curling past his shoulders like Medusa’s snakes. It would remind him not to look in those eyes. To stop, back off, stay away from the big bad demon.

Every word Crowley said sounded like a rattlesnake’s rattle.

But Aziraphale couldn’t stop. He couldn’t back away. Why? Because he wanted him. More than anything he wanted him. He wanted Crowley to coil around him like a rising fire, like a constrictor snake. He wanted to touch his hair and play with it, see if it was as soft as it looked.

That wasn’t meant to be, though. An angel, a demon…

All he could do was desire.

However, he did ask Crowley one sunset-dyed twilight, the two of them in St. James’ park. He was feeding ducks when he remembered the question.

“Crowley,” Aziraphale asked, “How do you tell if snakes are poisonous? It’s something to do with the red, right?”

And Crowley stared through him, red hair shifting in the breeze, a thin smile on his face.

“Oh, angel,” he whispered, voice red hot in Aziraphales ears, “Snakes aren’t poisonous.”

“I beg your pardon?”

Crowley moved just a little closer, and all Aziraphale could hear was danger, stop, back away, louder than the blood rushing through his ears.

“They’re not poisonous, they’re venomous.”

The two of them were mere inches apart. He could feel the heat of his breath. How even an inch forward would make their lips connect. How the passion in the kiss would burn him alive, surely. Burn off his wings.

Aziraphale brushed imaginary dirt off of his coat, stood, and left.

reblog.comment:

There was a way to tell which snakes were poisonous, and which ones weren’t. Something to do with their colors, which ones touched red and which ones weren’t. Black and red? Yellow and red? Red and yellow, you’re an unlucky fellow. That made sense.

Especially when he looked at Crowley. Those big yellow eyes stared through him, even when shielded by his sunglasses. They were lantern bright, they were laser beams. Beacons. The worst part was how beautiful they were.

And the red, oh, the red was his hair. No matter how he styled it, it stayed the same vibrant hell-fire red. Aziraphle would’ve been lying if he said that he didn’t prefer it one way or another, he liked when it was long, curling past his shoulders like Medusa’s snakes. It would remind him not to look in those eyes. To stop, back off, stay away from the big bad demon.

Every word Crowley said sounded like a rattlesnake’s rattle.

But Aziraphale couldn’t stop. He couldn’t back away. Why? Because he wanted him. More than anything he wanted him. He wanted Crowley to coil around him like a rising fire, like a constrictor snake. He wanted to touch his hair and play with it, see if it was as soft as it looked.

That wasn’t meant to be, though. An angel, a demon…

All he could do was desire.

However, he did ask Crowley one sunset-dyed twilight, the two of them in St. James’ park. He was feeding ducks when he remembered the question.

“Crowley,” Aziraphale asked, “How do you tell if snakes are poisonous? It’s something to do with the red, right?”

And Crowley stared through him, red hair shifting in the breeze, a thin smile on his face.

“Oh, angel,” he whispered, voice red hot in Aziraphales ears, “Snakes aren’t poisonous.”

“I beg your pardon?”

Crowley moved just a little closer, and all Aziraphale could hear was danger, stop, back away, louder than the blood rushing through his ears.

“They’re not poisonous, they’re venomous.”

The two of them were mere inches apart. He could feel the heat of his breath. How even an inch forward would make their lips connect. How the passion in the kiss would burn him alive, surely. Burn off his wings.

Aziraphale brushed imaginary dirt off of his coat, stood, and left.

trail.content_raw:
Red: Power, energy, passion, desire, speed, strength, power, heat, love, aggression, danger, fire, blood, war, violence, intensity, celebration, luck, stop, and danger.

blog.name: tangentqueenofdragons
blog.title: Guide this one to where the traveler never tires
blog.description: Order and consistency? On MY blog? Good luck, friend. Queer, autistic, asexual, feminist bitch. Depressed, stressed, and inconsistently dressed. Icon drawn by the lovely autistic-space-dragon

summary: I still remember how it all changed
body:
I still remember how it all changed

Aziraphale/Crowley. Ao3 version

It was part of the punishment. Lose your place in heaven, lose it completely. Not just the space, but your place in the minds of the angels still in Her grace. They would never remember him, and he would never be able to tell them.

“Well that one went down like a lead balloon,” he said. But what he wanted to say was It’s me, Aziraphale, it’s Rafael. Please say you remember me.

But he didn’t remember, and he wasn’t Rafael anymore. He had lost his name too, along with everything else.

‘Crawley’, they had renamed him and he hated it. Like some creature squirming at your feet. Like a snake.

But that’s what he was now.

Once, he had hung stars alongside the Almighty. Now he slithered in the dirt.

“Bit of an overreaction if you ask me,” he said. “First offence and everything.” And he meant that. Not just for the two banished humans, but for himself. All I ever did was ask questions he thought. Was that so terrible?

At least they still had each other thought. They had lost their home, but they hadn’t lost everything. Not like he had.

“Makes you wonder what God’s really planning,” he said, and he did wonder; was this all a part of that great, ineffable plan? Was he always supposed to fall? When he and Aziraphale had sat together in heaven, eyes and hands locked together, was it already written that someday, the angel - his angel - would look at him and see only a demon and a stranger?

And why? He had only asked questions. He’d never meant to fall.

“You’re an angel. I don’t think you can do the wrong thing,” he said, but he knew that wasn’t true, or else he wouldn’t be stood there with black wings and a name that wasn’t his own, next to an angel who didn’t know him.

“What if I did the right thing,” he said, and he hoped, deep down, that he had, that he could still do the right thing. That his falling had meant something, had a purpose. That it wasn’t just because he’d asked questions. That it was part of a greater plan.

Show me a great plan he wanted to say. Show me a reason why you had to cast me out. Show me a reason why he can’t know me.

Later, he would try to talk to Her. On his knees, calling out to Her, please, please, if nothing else, just let him remember me.

He would be met with silence

blog.name: crowleypaintrain
blog.title: Can I hear a wahoo?
blog.description:
Amanda • 30 • She/Her • Bi
Currently mostly a Good Omens blog, because the hyperfixation is real. Other things get sprinkled in here and there, but it all just turns into Good Omens again when I'm back on my bullshit.
I love one (1) idiot demon disaster, Anthony Janthony Crowley.

tags: Shhh I'm just thinking a lot about Aziraphale's love for Crowley right now
summary: Aziraphale: Ok, so maybe I love Crowley. That's... that's weird, right? Haha. Yeah. Aaaah, watch out, here comes the weirdo...
body:
Aziraphale: Ok, so maybe I love Crowley. That's... that's weird, right? Haha. Yeah. Aaaah, watch out, here comes the weirdo angel who's in love with the demon. The only thing that would be weirder is if he loved me back. Good thing that will never happen. Yikes.
Church Scene: *happens*
Aziraphale: Oh

summary:
Okay fun silly headcanon time because a lot of Queen songs were popping up on my spotify today 
When singing along to "Killer...
body:
Okay fun silly headcanon time because a lot of Queen songs were popping up on my spotify today

When singing along to “Killer Queen” Crowley makes a slight edit to this line

Changing cake to crepes just because he thinks it’s funny when Aziraphale huffs and gives him a light smack on the arm

blog.name: aziraphales-miracles
blog.description: A comprehensive account of every miracle Aziraphale has performed, in no particular order.

summary: Miracle #4
body:
Miracle #4

To make Crowley’s eyes widen like a cats. Out of pure curiosity. Definitely not because he thought it would be cute.
